name: New Mexico Guard Education Fund (NMGEF)
description: Pays 100% of tuition and fees at ANY New Mexico public post-secondary institution for New Mexico National Guard members. Covers undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral programs. Can be used IN ADDITION to federal tuition assistance. Members must maintain 2.0 GPA and continue Guard service.
eligibility: New Mexico National Guard member in good standing
Enrolled in New Mexico public college/university
how_to_apply: Apply through New Mexico National Guard Education Office

name: Vietnam Veterans Scholarship
description: Children of Vietnam veterans who are New Mexico residents receive scholarship covering tuition, fees, and books at New Mexico public colleges and universities. Veteran parent must have been New Mexico resident at time of military entry.
eligibility: Parent was New Mexico resident at military entry
how_to_apply: Apply through New Mexico Higher Education Department

name: Children of Deceased and Disabled Veterans Scholarship
description: Children (under 26) of veterans who died on active duty during wartime OR have 100% service-connected disability receive FREE tuition and fees at New Mexico public colleges/universities. Private institutions may offer similar benefits.
eligibility: Parent died on active duty during wartime OR 100% service-connected disabled
Parent was New Mexico resident at military entry
benefit_amount: FREE tuition + fees at public institutions
how_to_apply: Apply through New Mexico Higher Education Department

name: In-State Tuition for Veterans and Dependents
description: Veterans using GI Bill benefits and their dependents qualify for in-state tuition rates at New Mexico public colleges regardless of residency. Includes active duty service members and spouses.
eligibility: Veteran using GI Bill OR dependent using transferred benefits
how_to_apply: Submit eligibility documentation to New Mexico institution

name: Disabled Veteran Property Tax Exemption (NEW 2025)
description: NEW as of January 1, 2025! Veterans with service-connected disability receive property tax exemption on primary residence. Amount: $10,000 PLUS adjustments for inflation since 2020. Applies to honorably discharged veterans with ANY disability rating. Must own and occupy property as primary residence.
how_to_apply: Apply with County Assessor with VA disability documentation
source_name: New Mexico Taxation and Revenue Department

name: Proportional Disabled Veteran Property Exemption (Effective 2026)
description: Starting January 1, 2026: Property tax exemption becomes PROPORTIONAL to disability rating. For example, 50% disabled = 50% of exemption amount. Replaces flat $10,000 exemption with disability-based scaling. Still includes inflation adjustments.
how_to_apply: Apply with County Assessor starting 2026 with VA disability documentation
source_name: New Mexico Taxation and Revenue Department

name: 100% Disabled Veteran Full Property Tax Exemption
description: Veterans with 100% service-connected disability may qualify for FULL property tax exemption on primary residence (up to $400,000 assessed value as of 2024). Not subject to maximum $10,000 cap.
benefit_amount: Full exemption up to $400,000 assessed value
how_to_apply: Apply with County Assessor with 100% VA disability documentation
source_name: New Mexico Taxation and Revenue Department

name: Military Pay Income Tax Exemption
description: Active duty military pay is exempt from New Mexico state income tax for service members who are legal residents of New Mexico.
benefit_amount: 100% exemption on active duty military pay
how_to_apply: Exclude from New Mexico income tax return
source_name: New Mexico Taxation and Revenue Department

name: Military Retirement Pay Tax Exemption
description: Military retirement pay is 100% exempt from New Mexico state income tax. Includes Armed Forces retirement, National Guard retirement, and Reserve retirement.
how_to_apply: Exclude from New Mexico income tax return
source_name: New Mexico Taxation and Revenue Department

name: Survivor Benefit Plan (SBP) Tax Exemption
description: Survivor Benefit Plan payments to surviving spouses are exempt from New Mexico state income tax.
how_to_apply: Exclude from New Mexico income tax return
source_name: New Mexico Taxation and Revenue Department

name: Veterans Employment Preference
description: New Mexico state agencies must give hiring preference to honorably discharged veterans when qualifications are equal. Includes preference for veterans with disabilities.
how_to_apply: Indicate veteran status on state job applications with DD-214

name: Veteran-Owned Business Certification
description: Certification program for veteran-owned businesses. Provides access to state procurement opportunities and contract preferences.
benefit_amount: Access to state contracts and procurement preferences
how_to_apply: Apply through New Mexico Taxation and Revenue Department
source_name: New Mexico Taxation and Revenue Department

name: FREE State Parks Annual Pass (NEW 2025)
description: NEW as of 2025! Honorably discharged veterans with New Mexico ID receive FREE annual pass to all New Mexico State Parks. Pass covers vehicle entry and camping discounts.
eligibility: New Mexico resident with state ID
benefit_amount: FREE annual state parks pass (vehicle entry + camping discounts)
how_to_apply: Present DD-214 and NM ID at state parks

name: Disabled Veteran Hunting and Fishing Licenses
description: Disabled veterans (40%+ rating) receive discounted or FREE hunting and fishing licenses. 100% disabled veterans receive FREE lifetime licenses.
how_to_apply: Apply through New Mexico Department of Game & Fish with VA documentation
source_name: New Mexico Department of Game & Fish

name: Disabled Veteran Hunting Draw Preference
description: Disabled veterans receive preference in draw applications for big game hunting licenses. Increases odds of receiving coveted hunting tags.
benefit_amount: Draw preference for big game hunting licenses
how_to_apply: Indicate veteran status on draw applications
source_name: New Mexico Department of Game & Fish

name: Special Veteran License Plates
description: Special veteran license plates available for qualifying veterans including: general veteran plates, disabled veteran plates, Purple Heart plates, Medal of Honor plates, POW plates, and branch-specific plates. Some FREE, others reduced fee.
benefit_amount: FREE or reduced fee specialty plates
how_to_apply: Apply at New Mexico MVD with DD-214 and qualifying documentation

name: New Mexico Veterans Service Offices
description: Network of Veterans Service Officers throughout New Mexico providing FREE assistance with VA claims, benefits applications, and veteran resources. Offices in every county.
eligibility: New Mexico resident veteran or family member
benefit_amount: FREE VA claims assistance and benefits counseling
how_to_apply: Contact local county Veterans Service Office
source_name: New Mexico Department of Veterans Services

name: New Mexico Veterans Memorial Cemetery
description: State veterans cemetery in Angel Fire providing burial services for eligible veterans and spouses. No cost to families.
how_to_apply: Contact New Mexico Veterans Memorial Cemetery
source_name: New Mexico Department of Veterans Services
